name: CreateOrReactivateCustomField
description:
Create or reactivate a custom field on Ramp.

Use this tool to create a new custom field on Ramp or reactivate an existing inactive custom field. If the field already exists, it will return the existing field without creating a new one. To update an existing field, use the PATCH endpoint instead.

parameters.name: custom_field_external_id
parameters.description: Remote/external ID of the custom accounting field from the ERP system.

value_schema.description: Remote/external ID of custom accounting field from ERP system.

parameters.name: input_type_option
parameters.description: Specifies if the input type is SINGLE_CHOICE, BOOLEAN, or FREE_FORM_TEXT for the custom field.

value_schema.description: The input type could be SINGLE_CHOICE, BOOLEAN or FREE_FORM_TEXT.

parameters.name: custom_accounting_field_name
parameters.description: Name of the custom accounting field to be created or reactivated on Ramp.

value_schema.description: name of the custom accounting field.

parameters.name: custom_field_display_name
parameters.description: The name of the custom accounting field as displayed on Ramp. This should be a clear and descriptive name.

value_schema.description: The name of the custom accounting field as shown on Ramp.

parameters.name: required_object_types_for_sync
parameters.description: List of object types that need this accounting field for coding before syncing.

value_schema.description: Types of objects that require this accounting field to be used for coding before they can be marked as ready to sync.

parameters.name: enable_split_line_annotation
parameters.description: Set to true to allow the field to annotate split line items. Defaults to false if unspecified.

value_schema.description: If set to True, the accounting field can be used to annotate split line items. If not specified, the default value will be False.
